cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island, or 105 miles E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift WNW tonight, turn NW Tuesday, then curve NNE just offshore the Florida east coast toward Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No Florida landfall expected; center forecast to remain just offshore the northeast Florida coast

weather_observation.under_warning: None (but Storm Surge Warning in effect)
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Storm Surge Warning Lantana FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northeast Florida shoreline north of Jupiter Inlet through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely; hurricane-force gusts possible as core passes just offshore (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 4–7 ft inundation above ground level along the lower St. Johns River and adjacent coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 10 inches, creating flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large, dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands
